com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface AgentStatusService4

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface AgentStatusService4
extends Service

This service interface provides agents with a means to asynchronously report life cycle events to the agent framework. In version 4 of this service, the notification mechanism has been updated to allow listeners to be notified when an change in the Agent's state is pending. See AgentLifecycleStateChangeListener2

Since:
5.6.10

Method Summary

Method Detail

agentFailure

void agentFailure()
Invoking this method means that the corresponding agent cannot continue operating in a normal way.

As a result of calling this method the agent framework will attempt to destroy the agent by invoking methods on the Agent interface according to the current state of the agent.

dataCollectionFailure

void dataCollectionFailure()
Invoking this method means that the corresponding agent cannot continue collecting data. As a result of calling this method the agent framework will halt futher collections on this agent by calling stopDataCollection and reporting the failure to the server. The agent will not be deactivated and may continue running code.

getCurrentAgentState

AgentLifecycleState getCurrentAgentState()
The current state that the agent is in

Returns:
Current Agent State

getPendingAgentState

AgentLifecycleState getPendingAgentState()
The AgentState that is pending

Returns:
Pending Agent State

isAgentStateChangePending

boolean isAgentStateChangePending()
Check if there is an Agent State change pending. This is the preferred method to handle pending state changes. Periodic calls here during various stages of long running data collection tasks should be done in order to be alerted to pending state changes, and back out of current collection cycle.

Returns:
true if a state change is pending

registerAgentStateChangeListener

void registerAgentStateChangeListener(AgentLifecycleStateChangeListener2 listener)
                                      throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Register an AgentStateChangeListener to be notified when AgentState changes are pending

Parameters:
listener - To be notify when state changes are pending
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - will be thrown if the Agent is not running in asynchronous mode

removeAgentStateChangeListener

void removeAgentStateChangeListener(AgentLifecycleStateChangeListener2 listener)
Un-registers the AgentStateChangeListener

Parameters:
listener - To remove from notification queue

resumeDataCollection

void resumeDataCollection()
Invoking this methods means that the error condition that cause the agent to stop collecting data has cleared and the agent can once again resume collecting data. The agent framework will respond by notifying the FMS about the agent's new state and calling startDataCollection on the agent.
